isis.stitle: FRONT STEER AXLE: EATON EFA-12 - INSPECT - TIE ROD INSPECTION

svcproc.title: TIE ROD INSPECTION
svcproc.para: For more detailed inspection guidelines, refer to S02001, Steering General Service Information and Front Wheel Alignment, in GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: Shake cross tube. Movement or looseness between the tapered shaft of the ball and the cross tube socket members indicates that tie rod end assembly should be replaced.

The threaded portion of both tie rod ends must be inserted completely in the cross tube split. This is essential for adequate clamping. Replace components if this fit cannot be obtained (refer to TIE ROD END REPLACEMENT).

Ball and socket torque (exclusive of boot resistance) should be 5 inch-pounds (0.6 Nm) or more on disconnected tie rod end assemblies. Replace assemblies that test less than 5 inch-pounds (0.6 Nm). Loose assemblies will adversely affect steering performance. They may prevent adjustment of the steering assembly to specifications.
